rev.comment: Last few sections were repeated, too.
The whole beginning of the article, up through 4.1, "Former Personalities" was repeated.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/68.109.223.137|68.109.223.137]] to last version by RonMexico
/* Ratings */ Expounded on points-vs-cume ratings analysis.
/* History */ Removed paragraph about "visual presentation of news" because prior TV news networks relied on what... SOUND? SMELLS?
/* Former personalities */ disambiguation link repair repair
/* Former personalities */ disambiguation link repair ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|You can help!]])
Changed picture to thumb (so can englarge)
picture made to thumb (can enlarge by clicking on image)
POV deleted... no corresponding discussion started in talk page
re-add some of the deleted info... see the Collins book
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ Fixed typos; removed POVs.
/* Criticisms of on-air liberal personalities */ & -> and
/* Ratings */ over the last day this sentence has become full of POV - objective news - news can be subjectively presented and the choice of stories to present can be subjective - stick to facts
/* History */ then let's make no judgment of the FNC even at the beginning, then.
i'm not really sure what "racially suspect" means
/* Criticisms of on-air conservative personalities */ Mediamatters is the actual link cited; citing them beforehand is redundant recognition and diminishes article's objectivity.
the criticism/bias section is down below.
/* Ratings */ Okay, it was a bit redundant...
/* Ratings */ Critics' analysis may be a POV, but imparting the existence of their analysis without ascribing an opinion to its conclusions is not.
Slogans and one professor's study regarding bias do not belong here.
edit the revision in history, see Rosenberg column, 10/11/96 Los Angeles Times
no reason for the verbose opening
U.S., not US; also, no source given for "ubiquity", though it is an awesome word
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ What's good for the goose... this is paraphrased from the article on CNN.
/* Other countries */ re-wrote the Japan sentence
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ Phew... major copy-edit, removal of a few unsourced things, removal of several more irrelevant things, and one or two from an unreliable source.
/* Trademark disputes */ remove wikilink that dowsn't exist - last edit
these don't need to be so long - quoting allegations from a petition that was later withdrawn is not appropriate
/* Ownership and management */ link should be a reference not a sentence
explain ratings issue in plain language - editing continuing
trying to restore some POV - first edit
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/68.105.184.247|68.105.184.247]] ([[User talk:68.105.184.247|talk]]) to last version by Amibidhrohi
removed "pro-republican, conservative" language from first sentence. this is clear bias.
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */"No "competitors" are cited as criticizing Fox News.
It's a sourced statement from UCLA, not precisely friendly to the right.
/* Trademark disputes */Brush up on your vocabulary; you call relevance of trademark dispute (not) "even debatable," and website remains "obscure" despite Olbermann & Franken discussing it on MSNBC.
to whoever keeps posting that paragraph: stop pimping your obscure website on what is supposed to be a serious encyclopedia article
striving to make things a little more accurate.
she's a guest, not a host, and appears on more channels than just fox news. this doesn't belong here, and calling someone racist in an encyclopedia is WAY out of bounds
based on the most recent study http://www.newsroom.ucla.edu/page.asp?RelNum=6664
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.166.217.154|24.166.217.154]] ([[User talk:24.166.217.154|talk]]) to last version by Parallel or Together?
/* Programming */ continuity with conservative and liberal
/* Former personalities */ Alphabetized former personalities section.
/* Former personalities */ Added Ann Coulter and Dennis Miller to former personalities.
Explained difference in ratings points and cumulative ratings figures.
/* Criticisms of on-air conservative personalities */ Cleaned up clumsiness, added key complaint of O'Reilly's critics.
/* Criticisms of on-air conservative personalities */Removed unnecessary quotes from *rhetoric*
/* Criticisms of on-air liberal personalities */ We already know Colme's "neglect" is an Al Franken accusation - no need to double up by calling it "alleged."
/* Trademark disputes */ Clarified the "disputed" does, indeed, belong under a "Trademark Dispute" section.
/* Trademark disputes */Adding pertinent info that, apparently, frightens someone.
the phrase "capitilizing on viewers fears" is POV.
Note about bias is fine in intro
the info about Ailes involvement in Republican campaigns was already mentioned in the management section.
comments about conservative bias belong in the bias section.
rv POV that only liberals criticize Fox News
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ edia -> Media
"inexplicably" removing this again. Olberman and Franken sharing a laugh about a T-Shirt does not belong in this encyclopedia article. not sure how this is even debatable.
cnn and fox both have lots of guests, with views all over the spectrum. i fail to see how this is a controversy.
/* Trademark disputes */ Added pertinent info previously, and inexplicably, removed.
not sure the point of that paragraph, it said nothing about foxnews
not important enough for inclusion, especially given how long the criticism section already is
/* Criticisms of on-air conservative personalities */ typo
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ (added sean hannity and alan colmes)
the removed sentence has nothing to do with a trademark dispute that i saw
/* Criticisms of on-air liberal personalities */ rm invalid criticism
removed a section that was only marginally about Fox News.
not really necessary for an encyclopedia article.
the section is entitled "criticisms", i removed the points that weren't criticisms
I don't see how a host giving a soft interview could be a controversy
/* graphics */ Out of context, Unsupported, Improper Grammar
NPOV - need to mention both since both are very common
replaced (modified) deleted intro text, i can't see anything wrong w/it, & it's significant enough to be addressed in intro
/* Trademark disputes */ updates Alternet case resolution
oops, I accidently edited the wrong previous version; restore all modifications
Fix cut and paste move complate
/* Reports, polls and studies */ If the poll spelled it favour, the Fox viewership would boycot it and start using "freely choose" instead of "favo(u)r"
/* Ownership and management */ Removed unsubstantiated claims, one irrelevant
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ removed "critic point" that is not more than a pun, removed unnessesarcy mention of steven colberts
Partially RV unsupported POV by Jibbajabba
/* Controversies and allegations of bias */ typo fix: "Fascist News Newtwork"
moved article here; will redirect "fox news"
cleanup - removed a host of redundant links and replaced categories with cat:fox news channel; needs tightening of sections on "criticism". Will move to title "Fox News Channel"
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/69.137.26.78|69.137.26.78]] to last version by 130.184.91.213
/* Reports, polls and studies */ corrected Bill O'Reilly link
took out off-topic, unreferenced, POV silliness
/* Criticisms of on-air liberal personalities */ spelling
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/69.107.155.180|69.107.155.180]] to last version by 67.2.148.246
/* [[New Zealand]] */ removed inappropiate addition of word
rv POV deletions by Mrmiscellanious; these claims are most certainly cited!
/* Other criticisms */ Removed comment; no claims attributed.
/* Trademark disputes */ vandals, I fart in your general direction
"Foxnews tells its viewers "We report you decide" seems too POV.
restored vandalism yet again, highly unannoying
rv to last by Grazon; the second set of edits is pushing the limits of NPOV
removed redundant info (there is a ratings section!)
/* Other countries */ FoxNews airs in Thailand
Bot: Changing category Foreign TV Channels broadcasting in the UK to Foreign television channels broadcasting in the United Kingdom
clarified lead section of Fox's assertion of being "Fair and Balanced"
/* Reports, polls and studies */ "compared to" changed to "compared with"
reverted vandalism yet again, highly annoying
restored vandalism yet again! Cut it in!
reverted vandalism yet again! Cut it out!
/* External links */ rm link to Fox RSS feeds (not every Fox page needs a link)
/* Programming */ edits Fox News address -- is part of the 1960s-70s additions to Rockefeller Center complex
Conservative is a fair and balanced description of Fox
Removed POV "Conservative" phrase in the opening paragraph
